Partnerships and Business Development Manager

Company Name Monash University Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 183 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job No.: 580257


Location:\xa0Clayton campus


Employment Type:\xa0Full-time


Duration:\xa0Fixed-term secondment until October 2019


Remuneration:\xa0$96,230 - $106,221 pa HEW Level 08 (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)


  • Be inspired, every day
  • Enjoy the freedom to discover something new
  • Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions


There’s a certain feeling you get from working at Monash University. It’s the feeling that you’re a part of something special. Something significant. So if you’re looking for the next chapter in your career, it’s here. You’ll be given the opportunity to challenge yourself, build on your skills, and make a significant contribution to a workplace that’s filled with energetic and inspiring people. Talent thrives here – and so do truly satisfying careers.


The Opportunity


The Partnerships and Business Development Manager is expected to effectively coordinate and contribute to the achievement of the Faculty's key objectives and programs pertaining to its strategic, research, business, and partnership development.


The position will work to develop partnerships with government, business, research and community-based organisations, non-government organisations, as well as other funders nationally and internationally, as appropriate, in the delivery of the Faculty's objectives and projects. In particular, the Partnerships and Business Development Manager will be responsible for the identification of relevant funding and business opportunities, and for providing detailed proposal and application support to researchers.


We are seeking someone with a degree or postgraduate qualification and extensive relevant experience in business development strategic project management, and/or experience of developing University partnerships.


Alternatively, an equivalent alternate combination of relevant knowledge, training and or experience in a tertiary environment is also desired. If you believe you can fulfil these requirements, you are strongly encouraged to apply.


This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.


At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.


Your application must address the selection criteria. Click on the "Apply on company website" button above for the full position description and instructions on how to apply for Monash jobs.


Enquiries

Group Manager, Research and Business Development, Bev Baugh, +61 3 9902 4596.


Closing Date

Wednesday 19 September 2018, 11:55 pm AEST

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Higher Education

Full-time

  • Management

Job description


Permanent Full-time position

Band 6 ($83,840-$90,837) plus 9.5% Super plus monthly ADO

Maribyrnong City Council is undergoing significant change in population growth, redevelopment, gentrification, and a transitioning economy is leading to an influx of new residents, businesses and opportunities.

An exciting and rewarding opportunity exists to work with the Maribyrnong City Council's Early Years Team as the Team Leader Early Years. This position mentors a range of Early Years team members to support the high quality provision of portfolios. Additionally this position plays a role in strengthening the local sector by aligning actions and progressing partnership approaches with local Early Years providers.

This position is available for an experienced Early Years professional to:

  • Support the delivery and community engagement processes of the Central Registration System (CRS).
  • Support the delivery of community development and capacity building activities.
  • Support the delivery of the Maribyrnong Supported Playgroup Program.
Work with staff from the local sector to facilitate collaborative actions to build participation and support local families to have clear pathways into universal Early Years Services.

Play a pivotal role in the Early Years Leadership Group and provide active input into strategic planning and policy development.

We are a child safe organisation and an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to child safety and supporting the best interests of children in all our operations. Council encourages young people, people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.

Enquiries: Grace Nicol, Coordinator Early Years and Partnerships on (03) 9688-0117.

[

User Experience (UX) Designer

Company Name AKQA Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At AKQA, we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.


As a UX Designer, you’ll apply your deep knowledge of iterative, user-centred design to deliver the highest quality user-centred solutions. Your work will include requirements gathering, user research and profiling, workflow diagrams, content hierarchies, wireframing, prototyping, usability testing and interface development. And you’ll collaborate with visual designers, data specialists, content writers and other project team members to explore and propose elegant and innovative UX solutions.


At AKQA, you’ll work in a meritocratic culture surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow within a creative and technically advanced team, with access to ongoing personal and professional development. At AKQA, we’re committed to your career growth, as well as your work/life balance.


\xa0

ROLE REQUIREMENTS


  • Facilitate and advocate a user-centred design process.
  • Participate in user research, including customer interviews and user testing.
  • Meet with clients to understand their requirements (business analysis).
  • Lead and participate in team brainstorms and other idea generation activities.
  • Sketch high-level strategic concepts that answer user and business needs.
  • Create information architecture and interactive prototypes in ‘clickable’ prototype platforms such as Axure.
  • Present solutions to team members and clients in clear and compelling ways.
  • Oversee the implementation of solutions and provide tactical interaction design as required.

\xa0


QUALITIES AND CHARACTERISTICS


  • Deep knowledge of user-centric design, information architecture, experience strategy, product and service design and associated qualitative and quantitative customer research techniques
  • Broad (but less in-depth) knowledge of visual design, front-end software development etc.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • The ability to mentor junior experience designers.
  • Intellectual curiosity and a keen eye on the future of design and technology.

\xa0


AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA’s ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Project Development Manager - Renewable Energy

Company Name Hays Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Fortune 500 company developing the renewable energy sector
  • Create your own development team and market strategy
  • A unique market opportunity with excellent financial backing


Fortune 500 company - Huge financial backing - Existing assets - Wind - Solar - Storage

Your new company
 Hays are working exclusively and in partnership with an integrated construction group that provides investment, financing, design, engineering, planning and equipment manufacturing within the energy and power space. They also have global involvement in resources, environmental, water and real estate developments and are ranked in the fortune 500. Our client are a multiple award winning enterprise who are now extending their footprint to the Australian renewable energy market, headquartering in Melbourne's CBD.

Your new role
 As the first employee in their Project Development group, you will be working closely with the General Manager and Vice President to determine a strategy by analysing market trends within wind, solar and storage projects across Australia.

You will also be responsible for the development and connection to the client resources of Australian renewable energy project investment and financing. Furthermore, you will be involved in conducting marketing plans and developing the companies footprint here in Australia.

You will be targeting projects starting from 50MW and upwards and will be expected to engage in developments where you will become the majority shareholder.

What you'll need to succeed
 To be considered for this position you will have a proven background in the renewable energy sector in Australia, developing either wind, solar or storage projects. You will be familiar with the development process including business development with renewable energy investment projects. Those with an entrepreneurial flair will be highly regarded as well as those that have managed and built teams.

What you'll get in return
 In return you will be working for a company who will offer unrivaled autonomy in the market to develop the business as you see best in the current energy market. You will be offered an excellent salary package and the freedom to build a team as you see fit. This role comes with all the excitement of a start up but with unbelievable financial backing.

What you need to do now
 If you feel that this matches your skill set and you are looking to move into a role that can offer fantastic career development into a very senior role, please give Paul a call on 03 9670 2066 or email your CV to paul.tamplin@hays.com.au

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

  • Renewables & Environment

Full-time

856366516:
[

Associate or Senior Associate - Dispute Resolution ( Intellectual Property)

Company Name MinterEllison Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

MinterEllison is one of the Asia Pacific's leading law firms. Established in Sydney in 1827, our firm today operates in Australia, Hong Kong, mainland China, Mongolia, New Zealand and the United Kingdom through a network of integrated and associated offices.

Our culture

At MinterEllison, our people are our brand. Every day, every person in our firm plays a vital role in helping clients to resolve disputes, close deals, find solutions, grasp opportunities and create value. We are a friendly and supportive firm that takes pride in our work, our people, our individual and collective achievements, our clients' success, and our strong reputation in the marketplace.

The Intellectual Property team

Our IP lawyers provide sophisticated, practical advice, and skilled handling of complex high-profile litigation. We are particularly experienced in working with global legal teams and coordinating litigation strategy across jurisdictions. Our clients span the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, telco, medical, consumer, wagering, content, agricultural, IT, energy, mining, coatings and manufacturing industries.

Our team is also the only fully integrated patent attorney and patent law practice within an Australian law firm. Our multidisciplinary team includes lawyers with scientific qualifications, registered trade mark attorneys and registered patent attorneys.

As such, we approach all litigious and commercial matters with a deep understanding of the technology involved, along with the practical and legal issues that may arise when seeking to protect the IP rights in that technology.

Your role

A great opportunity currently exists for an experienced IP litigator to join MinterEllison in Melbourne. In this role you will work closely with Jonathan Kelp, partner, and senior lawyers in the Intellectual Property team on a broad range of intellectual property and technology matters.

What You Need

We welcome applications from experienced lawyers with
  • Strong technical expertise in IP matters, ideally gained in a recognised Australian or international IP practice, including substantial experience in conducting IP litigation;
  • A strong client focus and demonstrated ability to form enduring relationships with peers, clients and industry experts;
  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment;
  • Resilience and a commitment to excellence that matches our own; and
  • Pride in your work and who you work for.


What We Offer

As a lawyer at MinterEllison you'll be working with major multi-national, regional and local companies as well as government organisations and state-owned entities. These clients trust us with their biggest and most complex deals that span jurisdictions and their high stakes disputes. You'll be part of a team, collaborating across practice areas and across offices and working with partners who are recognised as leaders in their fields.

You will enjoy working in an environment where people care about ensuring that you balance your professional goals with your interests outside of work. We offer competitive top tier employment packages and a wide range of employment benefits. Our internal support teams are second to none, and our learning and professional development programs are designed to maximise your legal technical expertise, client and solution focus, business acumen and leadership skills to help you take the next step in your career.

How To Apply

We prefer to deal with you directly, so please submit your CV, cover letter and academic transcripts for consideration by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. If you would like further information, please contact Mariah Ioannidis 03 8608 2372 for a highly confidential discussion.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

Industry

  • Law Practice
  • Legal Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology

Social Media Specialist

Company Name HASSELL Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 80 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Creative Studio | Global opportunities | Digital transformation

The role

Are you a passionate social media professional looking to shape your career within an award-winning global design firm?

We are on the hunt for a Social media specialist to take ownership of creating, growing and nurturing great social communities for HASSELL and FreeState. Working from our Melbourne studio, but with an international focus, this role requires both strategic and creative thinking to improve our digital brand experience and to support our global expansion.

Day-to-day the role will include multiple activities such as developing content strategies and calendars for our global projects and people, creating content for programs and campaigns, devising media buy strategies to reach target audiences, managing communities, monitoring content success and managing different internal stakeholder groups and approvals.

You will report to the Marketing and Communications Manager and will collaborate with the business, Heads of Design and agency partners along with the wider Marketing and Communications team to deliver exceptional social experiences.

About You

You’re well into your social career with four plus years’ experience under your belt in a similar role either from a professional services, creative or agency environment.

You will have completed a communications, marketing, journalism or similar degree and will have a genuine passion for developing great online communities with experience across Instagram, LinkedIn and Twitter in particular.

You will need to be flexible enough to move between strategy and implementation, bringing energy to everything you do. You’re a self-motivated and impactful person with impeccable spelling and grammar, Adobe suite skills and an eye for design and photography.

Up to speed on all the latest social trends, you’re known as an ‘in-house expert’ on all things social. Ideally, you will have experience working with multiple brand accounts, influencer strategies, paid targeting and campaigns. You will naturally be skilled in managing social toolsets for listening, publishing, planning and reporting (Meltwater Engage, Sprout social, Planoly or similar).

Why HASSELL?

Our people are our practice. With that in mind, we place great emphasis on attracting, retaining and developing the best talent.

As a practice, we place value on the quality of ideas and the contribution our people make to our open and collaborative culture. We support innovation and creativity, enabling exceptional design outcomes.

We value diversity employing people across a number of regions, representing many different cultures and ethnic backgrounds.

Our team have access to a range of benefits to support development and wellbeing:
_Creative studio working environment
_Inter-studio transfer opportunities
_Development and training including access to an online training program
_Wellbeing benefits
_Flexible start and finish times, part time and job share arrangements.

In this role, you will help lead the development of our social media strategy. This an amazing opportunity that offers the chance to work in a creative culture, to be part of a passionate and inspiring team yet have significant freedom to carve out real career opportunities, and enjoy meaningful personal and professional development.

Apply now

If this role sounds like the next step in your career, please send your cover letter and CV clearly outlining how you meet the above requirements to careers@hassellstudio.com. Please include the following subject line on your application: GROUP_SOCIALMEDIASPECIALIST_AUG2018.

HASSELL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

No agencies or third party applications please.

Industry

  • Architecture & Planning

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Marketing
  • Public Relations
  • Writing/Editing

Health, Safety and Environment Lead

Company Name Life Without Barriers Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 86 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Life Without Barriers has been selected by the Victorian Government to operate a number of Supported Independent Living (SIL) and Short Term Accommodation and Assistance Programs (STAA) currently managed by the Department of Health & Human Services (VIC). To make the transfer of the services to Life Without Barriers as smooth as possible for the clients, staff and families involved, a number of positions are now available in this exciting project. These positions include a Health, Safety and Environment Lead that will be based in Inner East Melbourne. Due to this growth we are currently finalising a property for our new office which will be Inner East Melbourne. \xa0
\xa0\xa0
Key Responsibilities
  • Provide effective leadership of the HSE team across Victoria
  • Partner with, advise and provide support to Client Services on a range of complex health, safety, environmental and security matters
  • Coach and support a step change in safety planning, implementation and outcomes for the organisation
  • Support and implement improvements across areas such as HSE policies and procedures, HSE systems and Workers Compensation
  • Develop, implement and manage HSE systems to support line management accountability and employee buy in to deliver a safer workplace
  • Provide advice on contractor and third party HSE compliance requirements
  • Implement and facilitate workplace programs such as hazard identification, risk management, wellbeing and HSE competence
  • Ensure reporting is accurate, information is available for analysis on time and as required
  • Establish key health and safety performance measures and deliver a continuous improvement culture in the HSE portfolio.


Skills & Experience
  • Tertiary qualifications in Workplace Health and Safety (or related field)
  • Extensive experience in implementing and monitoring a safety management system within a medium to large organisation operating in multi-site operations
  • Demonstrated experience as a HSE practitioner implementing significant organisational change
  • Demonstrated understanding of current workplace safety, health and environment legislative requirements
  • Demonstrated experience managing HSE professionals
  • Ability to influence and work collaboratively with a range of stakeholders including peers, employees, external organisations, funding bodies and government agencies.


Successful candidates will be required to clear probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check and Working with Children Check (where relevant to the role).
\xa0\xa0 \xa0
Benefits
  • Opportunity to work for one of Australia's largest social purpose organisations
  • Excellent tax benefits and rostered days off
  • Join a growing and transforming organisation


How to Apply
Include your resume and covering letter in one document, click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For any enquiries including persons with disability that require adjustments, contact recruitment@lwb.org.au

Applications close at midnight 9 September 2018. \xa0
